inkball

Class Wall

  • java.lang.Object
    • inkball.Entity
      • inkball.Wall
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Drawable

    public class Wall
extends Entity
implements Drawable
    The Wall class represents a wall in the Inkball game. Walls are stationary objects that interact with balls when they collide. Each wall has a position, a color, and a collision buffer to control collision detection frequency.

      • Wall

        public Wall(int x,
            int y,
            int color,
            App p)
        Constructs a Wall object.
        Parameters:
        x - The x-coordinate of the wall.
        y - The y-coordinate of the wall.
        color - The color of the wall (used to load the appropriate image).
        p - The App instance used to load images.

      • checkCollision

        public void checkCollision(Ball ball,
                           App p)
        Checks for a collision between the ball and the wall. If a collision is detected, the ball's velocity is reflected, and its color may be updated to match the wall's color.
        Parameters:
        ball - The Ball object to check for collision.
        p - The App instance, used for updating the ball's color if necessary.

      • draw

        public void draw(App p)
        Draws the wall at its current position on the screen.
        Specified by:
        draw in interface Drawable
        Parameters:
        p - The App instance used for drawing the wall.
